title: Supreme Court Permits Mississippi Social Media Age Verification Law
snippets: The law requires all users to verify their ages before using common social media sites ranging from Facebook to Nextdoor.
The challenge brought on by the trade group alleges that the age verification law is a violation of free speech
Justice Brett Kavanaugh said the law would “likely” violate the First Amendment rights of social media companies.

The Supreme Court will let Mississippi’s social media age verification law take effect while the case is being argued in court. In an unsigned ruling on Thursday, the court declined to block the law after an emergency petition from trade association NetChoice. The order offers no explanation, but in
titles: Supreme Court allows Mississippi social media law to go into effect
US Supreme Court declines to pause new Mississippi social media law
Supreme Court Will Let Mississippi Require Age Verification For Social Media—For Now
Supreme Court opens door to social media age-gating in US
summary: The Supreme Court has decided to allow Mississippi's social media age verification law to be implemented while legal challenges proceed. This law mandates all users to verify their ages on platforms like Facebook and Nextdoor. The decision came after an emergency petition from NetChoice, a trade group arguing the law infringes on free speech rights. Justice Brett Kavanaugh noted the law might violate the First Amendment. However, the court's unsigned ruling did not provide a rationale for allowing the law to take effect.

This decision was confirmed by a spokesperson for the Broward State Attorney's Office. Judkins, who has not yet signed his rookie contract, was awaiting the outcome of the legal process.

title: Trump Optimistic on Ukraine Deal Ahead of Summit with Putin in Alaska
snippets: Words come on the eve of the US and Russian leaders' closely watched Alaska summit.

However, the Kremlin cautioned against anticipating a major outcome from the meeting. The high-stakes summit, aimed at negotiating a ceasefire in the Russia-Ukraine conflict, is closely monitored by international observers. Both leaders will meet on Friday, with global attention on the potential for diplomatic progress.

title: 56 Dead, 50 Missing After Flash Floods Hit Kashmir, Affecting Pilgrims
snippets: At least 32 people have died and over 50 are missing after flash floods in Indian-administered Kashmir.
A second deadly flood in just over a week has struck another Himalayan village, this time in Indian-administered Kashmir. At least 56 people are reported to have been killed.
Hundreds more were missing, many of them Hindu pilgrims, after a cloudburst triggered flooding in mountainous terrain.
titles: Dozens feared dead in Kashmir flash floods
Kashmir: Flash flood kills dozens in Himalayan village
Pilgrimage Route Hit as Flash Flood Kills Dozens in Kashmir
summary: At least 56 people have died, with over 50 missing, following two separate flash floods in Indian-administered Kashmir, including one that impacted a Himalayan village. The floods, caused by a cloudburst, affected hundreds, including many Hindu pilgrims, in the mountainous region.

title: Drug Firms Hike Prices Abroad Under Trump's Pressure to Cut US Costs
snippets: It comes as President Donald Trump pressures drugmakers to lower U.S. drug prices while hiking them abroad under a policy called "most favored nation."
Maker of popular Mounjaro treatment seeks to address White House concerns over higher medicine costs for Americans

The US president had put pressure on the pharmaceutical industry to make drugs cheaper for Americans

The price of the weight loss jab Mounjaro will rise by up to 170% in the UK, its US manufacturer has said, as Donald Trump ramps up pressure on drugmakers to increase their prices for Europe
titles: Eli Lilly hikes price of diabetes drug Mounjaro in UK as Trump pressures pharma to align drug costs
Eli Lilly raises UK price of obesity drug by up to 170% after Trump ‘freeloading’ gripe
Eli Lilly ramps up UK price of weight loss jab Mounjaro after Trump demands
summary: Under pressure from President Donald Trump to reduce drug prices in the U.S., pharmaceutical companies are adjusting their pricing strategies. The manufacturer of Mounjaro, a popular weight loss treatment, announced plans to significantly increase its price in the UK by up to 170%. This move aligns with Trump's "most favored nation" policy, aiming to lower medication costs for Americans by raising them abroad. The policy reflects ongoing efforts to address concerns over high medicine costs in the United States.

title: Ancient DNA Traces Hungarian, Finnish Languages to Siberia Over 4,000 Years Ago
titles: Ancient DNA Solves Mystery of Hungarian, Finnish Language Family’s Origins
summary: Researchers have used ancient DNA to trace the origins of the Hungarian and Finnish languages, solving a long-standing mystery. The study found that these languages, part of the Uralic family, originated from populations in Western Siberia over 4,000 years ago. This discovery provides a clearer understanding of the migration and linguistic history of these groups, connecting their languages to a specific region and timeframe.

title: Ancient Proteins Reveal Early Human Relative's Diverse Diet
titles: Ancient Proteins Crack a 2-Million-Year-Old Human Relative Mystery
summary: Scientists have used ancient proteins extracted from a 2-million-year-old tooth of the Paranthropus robustus, an early human relative, to solve a long-standing mystery about human evolution. The study reveals new insights into the dietary habits of our ancient relatives, indicating a diverse diet that challenges previous beliefs about their nutrition and environment. This breakthrough in using protein analysis offers a new tool for understanding human ancestry and evolution.

titles: Trump’s Tariffs: Why Retail Could Look To China
summary: In 2025, the U.S. will adjust its tariff policies, affecting trade relations with China and India, and potentially impacting inflation rates, court challenges, and holiday retail. This shift, referred to as 'Liberation Day,' aims to modify the economic landscape, though the exact outcomes on global trade and domestic markets remain to be fully assessed.
